content: On July 4, 1993, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the San Diego Padres at Fulton County Stadium in a thrilling Independence Day matchup. The Braves triumphed 7-6 in a dramatic game that featured a key performance from Fred McGriff, who hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning to help secure the victory. This game was part of the Braves' memorable season, which would ultimately lead them to the World Series later that year.
